body.p: The SAT Math scores of 1,000 future engineers and physicists are recorded. What will be the relationship between the mean and median of the collected data?

multiple_choice.choice: The mean will be bigger than the median.
The mean will be smaller than the median.
The mean and median will be about the same.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The mean is smaller than the median when the distribution is skewed right. The SAT Math scores for these students will be mostly high scores, so the distribution will be skewed to the left.

Correct. Since the SAT Math scores for these students will be mostly high scores, the distribution will be skewed to the left. Thus, the few low scores (outliers) will make the mean smaller than the median.

Incorrect. The mean and the median will be about the same when the distribution is symmetric. The SAT Math scores for these students will be mostly high scores, so the distribution will be skewed to the left.

part.hint: Think about the shape of the distribution. Is it skewed right, skewed left, or symmetric?
